Dear Mr. Alward:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10177
Section (1) The facility shall establish and follow written policy and
Description procedures specifying the use of resident restraint.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/6/23, a youth was put in an improper restraint by a staff
member. The youth was grabbed by the neck and punched in the
face by the staff member.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on March 9,
2023. Complaint Source is identified as Youth B’s therapist. She
reported she did not have any additional information as Youth B
would not go into detail of the incident.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
8, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
on March 6, 2023, around 7:15 pm she was working with her pod
doing an awareness group. She reported she asked Staff 1 for a
pen and was told no which made her upset. Youth A reported
Staff 3 came into the unit and asked if anyone needed to do a
behavior chain, meaning they had to do a behavior modification
meeting. She reported Staff 1 kept tilting her head toward Youth A
to Staff 3. This increased Youth A’s agitation and she started to
swear at the staff. Staff 1 then unlocked the youth’s doors and
Youth A reported she knew she was going to be sent to her room
which she refused. Supervisor then entered the area and tried to
de-escalate her which increased Youth A's behavior to have a
verbal argument with Supervisor. She reported she began to slap
the cups on the tables, knock papers off desks, and flip and throw
chairs. Supervisor caught the chair Youth A threw at him and she
2

reported he then began to run at her. Youth A reported it was just
Supervisor with her at this time. She reported Supervisor threw
her against the wall and she hit her back left shoulder and head
on the wall. Youth A reported things began to get blurry and she
did not feel well. She reported Supervisor swung at her with a
closed fist and his knuckle hit her lip. Youth A reported she then
began to fight back. She reported she ended up on the ground
with her stomach facing the ground. Youth A reported the reason
she ended up on the ground was that Supervisor's body slammed
her to the ground. She stated he laid on her back, and this made
so her shoulder blade pop. Youth A reported Supervisor flipped
her to her back by putting her neck in the corner of his arm,
between his elbow and arm. She stated that he was choking her
at this time. Supervisor then called for support and Staff 3 came in
to support by grabbing Youth A’s legs. Youth A reported she then
was put into her room, and she began to escalate by flooding her
room. She reported some male nurse she did not know came in to
see her after the incident. Youth A reported she told him she was
lightheaded, and he did not do anything. She reported she was
able to see Nurse 2 this morning for the bumps on her head.
Youth A reported she felt that this restraint was a “dirty restraint”.
She reported this was her first restraint at this facility but has been
restrained at prior placements, so she is aware of what is
supposed to happen.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
March 15, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and
Detective. Supervisor had his own attorney present during the
interview. Supervisor reported on March 6, 2023, he received a
call that Youth A had been in an escalated state. Upon arrival at C
Pod, Youth A was upset because she wanted to make a phone
call instead of the activity. She had asked Staff 1 to use her
personal pen and Staff 1 stated that she could not. Youth A began
to swear at Staff 1 and she attempted to verbally de-escalate the
situation. Due to Youth A’s main target being Staff 1, Supervisor
told Staff 1 he would switch out with her. Supervisor reported he
attempted to verbally de-escalate Youth A and talk her through
techniques to calm herself. He reported Youth A began to hit
herself in the head with her fists as she was screaming about
being frustrated about her placement. Supervisor reported he
encouraged Youth A to go to her room and she stated “You guys
will have to restrain me.” Youth A then got up and began to knock
papers off the desk and flip and throw chairs. At this time
Supervisor reported he gave the single to the control room to go
on lockdown for the facility and told Staff 2 to strip Youth A’s room
for safety. Staff 3 entered the unit and Youth A continued to pace
3

around the room. She then threw a chair at Supervisor and Staff 3
which led Supervisor to go in for a restraint due to safety.
Supervisor reported when he went into the restraint, he attempted
to go into a CPI one person’s child control hold by grabbing onto
Youth A’s wrists. Due to Youth A being near the wall, he was not
able to get that grip and she ended up throwing a punch at
Supervisor’s shoulder. While Supervisor attempted to get a hold,
Youth A dropped her weight to the floor, and she went onto her
stomach. At this point Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 were there to
help with a team control hold. Supervisor yelled out that they
needed to get Youth A onto her back, and they did. He reported
the team got her on her back by rolling her on her shoulder and
when she rolled over, she did bite him on his hand/ forearm area.
He reported he never grabbed her by her neck to roll her and only
assisted her by guiding her shoulder in the roll with his hand.
Supervisor and Staff 2 grabbed her arms and Staff 3 and Staff 4
had control of her legs. The supervisor reported he gave the
direction to get Youth A up off the ground and escort her to her
room. He reported this was Staff 3’s first restraint and he ended
up lifting Youth A's feet off the ground when given the direction to
escort Youth A. Supervisor reported immediately he redirected
Staff 3 to put Youth A's feet down so that he had her feet on the
ground. Supervisor reported he knew what Staff 3 was doing was
not CPI compliant and he redirected right away. He reported
Youth A’s feet were off the ground for a couple of seconds.
Supervisor reported the staff was able to get Youth A into her
room and it was mostly stripped at this point. He reported all four
staff entered the room to get Youth A safely in her room and then
exited one by one. Supervisor reported he was the last one in the
room while the other staff stood right out the door. To keep Youth
A from coming out of the room he did have his arm out front to
keep space and keep her from coming to the door. Youth A then
began to flood her room and put the papers from the book that
was left in her room covering the windows. She flooded her room
by putting her shirt into the toilet and continued to flush the toilet.
Staff had to re-enter the room to clean the mess and make sure
the room was safe. Youth A did complain of her head hurting and
Supervisor had nursing come to see her. He reported she denied
medical treatment but has continued to have the medical team
check up on her. Supervisor had Staff 1 check Youth A’s head
and did note there was a bump but believes it is from when she
was hitting herself in the head before the restraint. Supervisor
reported he felt he did everything he could do with the restraint
appropriately to keep everyone safe. He reported he did have a
hard time getting into the initial hold as she dropped her weight to
the ground and was near the wall when he went into the restraint.
4

Supervisor reported he never pushed her or had his arm up by
Youth A’s neck causing her to choke. He reported does not
believe they hit the wall at any point and if they did it, he would
have hit the wall himself not Youth A. He reported Youth A never
complained about hitting the wall. Supervisor reported he gets
involved in a lot of escalated situations due to his role of being the
Supervisor on shift. He reported he floats around to the units when
assistance is needed. Supervisor reported on Youth A’s unit they
have had to be redirected for inappropriate behavior at times. He
reported he has never made any comments to the youth that they
cannot write grievances or that he doesn’t care if they write a
grievance about him.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
15, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Youth B reported she was in her room when Youth A was
restrained by Supervisor. She reported Youth A had pulled the
covering off her door window so that Youth B could see what was
happening while Youth B was in her room. She reported when she
first looked out her window, Youth A was walking around and
yelling while the staff was telling her to go to her room. Youth B
reported she then sat down in her room to braid her hair. She then
heard more yelling, so she looked up and saw Supervisor was
against the wall with Youth A and believes he threw her against
the wall but did not see it. Youth B reported she believes
Supervisor threw Youth A against the wall because she saw
Supervisor behind Youth A and heard a bang. She reported she
never saw Youth A punch the staff or be aggressive in any way
and believes Supervisor did a "dirty restraint". Youth B stated she
talked with Youth A who said Supervisor also threw her against
the wall. She reported she has complaints about Supervisor
talking about other youth's business such as the youth’s court
dates or how long the youth have been at the facility. Youth B
reported the youth can always file grievances and the Assistant
Superintendent will always come to talk to the youth who wrote it
to investigate the situation.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
15, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Staff 2 reported on March 6, 2023, her role was to be a floater
staff amongst all the pods. She reported she heard a lot of yelling
and screaming from C pod and went in to talk with Staff 1. It was
found Youth A was getting into a verbal argument with Staff 1.
Staff 2 notified Supervisor of the situation and he ended up
switching out with Staff 1 since Youth A was targeting her. All the
other girls on C pod went into their rooms and Staff 2 put up the
5

orange sheets for the tracking of bedroom checks. She reported
Supervisor continued to try to verbally de-escalate Youth A and
Staff 2 continued to do room checks. At that time, a youth also
asked to speak with Staff 2, and then Youth A began to throw
chairs. Staff 2 knew she needed to start to strip Youth A’s room
due to her unsafe behaviors. Youth A then threw a second chair
right at Supervisor and he went into a restraint. Staff 2 reported
the restraint initially happened close to the wall and did not see
them hit the wall. When Supervisor went into the restraint, Staff 2
saw Youth A drop her weight to the ground and because of that
motion, she saw Supervisor’s hand go toward Youth A’s upper
chest. She reported she then went into assisting Supervisor with
the restraint when Youth A was on the ground. Staff 2 reported
she had Youth A’s left shoulder and went into a CPI team control
hold. Supervisor had the right shoulder and Staff 3 and Staff 4 had
Youth A’s legs. Supervisor gave the command to get Youth A up
off the ground and Staff 3 began to lift her legs off the ground.
Supervisor redirect Staff 3 and they were able to get Youth A in
the appropriate team control hold within seconds. Staff 2 reported
Staff 3 is a newer staff and did not know that it was not a
approved restraint technique to lift Youth A's legs off the ground.
The staff was then able to get Youth A into her room. Staff 2
reported she did assist with cleaning up Youth A’s room when she
flooded it. She reported she feels the team followed the protocol of
restraint method and Supervisor did the best he could with Youth
A dropping her weight to the ground. Staff 2 reported she never
saw Supervisor punch Youth A or choke her with his arm or hand.
She reported she has no concerns with Supervisor’s interactions
with the youth or his ability to do his job appropriately.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on March 22, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he has only
been working at the facility for a couple of months. He reported
this incident was his first restraint. Staff 3 reported he first was
working the control center when he saw Supervisor single the
lockdown. When he arrived at C Pod he saw Youth A yelling and
throwing chairs. He reported he saw Youth A throw a chair at
Supervisor which led to Supervisor rushing up to her to restrain
her. He reported everything happened so quickly and Supervisor
was not giving clear directions on what to do. Staff 3 reported he
saw Youth A hit her head on the door during the restraint but was
not clear on how that happened. He reported he did see Youth A
drop her weight which led Supervisor to the ground with her. Staff
3 reported during the restraint he believes that Supervisor's hand
did go up by Youth A’s chest but was not on her neck and did not
choke her. He reported he believed Supervisor lost his balance
6

and that is why that happened. Staff 3 reported he still was not
sure what to do so he went to help Staff 2 with clearing out Youth
A’s room. Supervisor then yelled to get Youth A on her back and
for Staff 3 to grab her legs which he did with Staff 4. Staff 3
reported when Supervisor said to get Youth A up he thought that
meant lifting her legs. Supervisor redirected him immediately to
drop her legs and as soon as they crossed the threshold of her
room he did. Staff 3 reported Youth A’s legs were only up in the
air for a couple of seconds. He reported once she was in her
room, she spit on Supervisor but was able to calm down and he
had no concerns about the actions that took place after that. The
team then did a debrief and Youth A began to flood her room.
Staff 3 reported that the situation went better because Supervisor
was clear with the direction they were going to take and knew
what his role was. Staff 3 reported he was trained in CPI training
in January 2023 and feels that the situation did not seem fully
compliant with the training. Staff 3 reported he feels the facility
should provide extra training in restraints because he did not feel
comfortable. Staff 3 noted he had no concerns with Supervisors
interactions with the youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
15, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Staff 4 reported on March 6, 2023, he was on a different pod than
where the incident occurred. He reported he got notified of the
lockdown and got his pod of youth into their rooms. Staff 4
reported he then ran by the control center and asked where the
incident was and was told to go to C Pod. When he arrived, he
heard Supervisor tell Staff 2 and Staff 3 to get her on her back
from the restraint. Staff 4 assisted with grabbing Youth A’s legs
with Staff 3. He reported Staff 3 did lift Youth A’s legs off the
ground but was redirected by Supervisor to not do that. Supervisor
and Staff 2 did a CPI team escort of Youth A to her room. He
reported he did not see anything non-compliant with the restraint
besides Staff 3 lifting her legs but that was quickly redirected
within two seconds. Staff 4 reported Youth A did end up flooding
her room and he had to assist by standing by while Staff 2 and
Staff 5 cleaned up Youth A’s room. Staff 4 reported he has no
concerns with Supervisor’s interactions with the youth or his ability
to do his job correctly. He reported he has completed restraints
with Supervisor before and has had zero concerns.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on March 22, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A
was escalated because she wanted to use Staff 1’s ink pen and
she was not allowing her to do that. She reported Youth A does
7

not like her because she is strict on the rules and will redirect her
for swearing. Youth A began to swear about the situation and Staff
1 pulled out a behavior chain, which is when a youth needs to
write about their actions and review it with another staff member.
Youth A continued to get into a power struggle and began to throw
papers. That was when Supervisor came onto the unit to switch
oout with Staff 1 due to Youth A’s anger being directed towards
her. She stated she went into the control room where Staff 3 and
began to watch the camera of C Pod. Staff 1 noticed Supervisor
give the signal to go onto lockdown and Staff 3 got confused
about what to do so Staff 1 took over. She reported Staff 3 left to
go support on C Pod. Staff 1 reported when she looked at the
video, she saw Supervisor over by the door with Youth A in the
restraint and go down to the floor. She reported she did not see
the rest of the video. Staff 1 reported later that night she did check
in with Youth A and she said she had a knot on her head and her
head hurt. She reported she called Supervisor about this and then
nursing came. Staff 1 reported she felt a bump on Youth A’s head
about the size of a nickel. She reported she cannot remember
what Youth A said about how she got it. When asked if this bump
could have been caused by her hitting herself in the head before
the restraint out of frustration, Staff 1 reported it could have been
and noted Youth A is not known to do that to herself. Staff 1
reported she has seen Supervisor in other restraints, and he is
never rough with the youth and follows protocol. She reported she
does not have concerns with Supervisor's interactions with the
youth but noted he is sterner with them.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
15, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Staff 5 reported on March 6, 2023, she was working in a different
pod than where the incident occurred. She reported she could see
into the pod and heard Youth A screaming. Staff 5 reported when
she got notice of lockdown, she got her youth into their rooms and
then went over to Youth A’s pod. When she arrived, Youth A was
already in a restraint and was being moved into her room.
Supervisor and Staff 2 had her arms and Staff 3 and Staff 4 had
her legs. She reported the only thing she saw that was not
restraint compliant was Staff 3 briefly lifting Youth A's legs off the
ground but was quickly redirected by Supervisor. Staff 5 reported
she was a part of the staff debrief and Supervisor processed how
response times need to be quicker for the situation. During that
time, Youth A began to flood her room, and Staff 5 assisted with
cleaning and making the area safe for Youth A. Staff 5 reported
Youth A’s pod is not very fond of Supervisor due to him redirecting
8

situations. She reported she does not have any concerns with
Supervisor’s treatment of the youth or his ability to do his job.
Intern was interviewed via phone on March 22, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Intern reported she has
been interning at the facility for about 8 months. She reported she
witnessed the restraint occur but was not in the pod as per the
facility policy she cannot be. She reported she saw Staff 2
cleaning Youth A’s room and Supervisor and Staff 3 attempted to
verbally de-escalate Youth A. She reported Youth A then threw
the chair and Supervisor went into a restraint. Intern reported it
looks like Supervisor was going in for a bear hug, but Youth A
dropped to the ground on her own. She reported she did see
Supervisor’s hand near Youth A’s chest. During this time Staff 3
looked lost on what to do. Intern reported when they were on the
ground, she lost sight of what was going on due to the table in the
way. Intern reported she just sat in the CPI training this week to
learn more about the process. She reported Supervisor is a good
staff and due to his role, he has taken more of a sticker staff role
on the unit.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
15, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported she has been at the facility for about two months. On
March 6, 2023, Youth A began screaming at staff over papers and
staff told the youth they needed to go into their rooms. She
reported she heard Supervisor attempt to calm Youth A down.
Youth C reported most of her window was covered but she did
see Supervisor had Youth A in a restraint at one point because
Youth A threw a chair. She reported she did not really see
anything but heard the struggle. Youth C reported she feels safe
at the facility and has no concerns.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
15, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D
reported on March 6, 2023, the pod was doing an awareness
activity and Youth A was refusing to do it. Youth A and Staff 1 got
into a verbal argument about the refusal and then Supervisor
came into the unit. Youth D reported all the youth went into their
room and Youth A began to flip chairs. She reported her window
was covered but could see Youth A being restrained by
Supervisor. Youth D reported she saw Youth A turn purple. She
reported her room is next to Youth A’s room and heard her get
thrown in her room by Supervisor. Youth D reported she talked
with Youth A and she told her about Supervisor choking her and
that she had a knot on her head. She reported when she saw
9

Supervisor, she asked him why he did a “dirty restraint”, and he
denied it. Youth D reported the youth on the unit does not like
Supervisor because he never helps the youth and has a negative
attitude. To note, after reviewing the video, Youth D’s door is not
in eyesight of the incident.
Conference call was held with MDHHS Worker on March 29,
2023. MDHHS worker reported there are no findings to the
investigation.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage regarding the restraint from March 6, 2023,
involving Youth A was reviewed multiple times on March 15, 2023.
The video footage was consistent with Supervisor and all staff
interviews. The video before the restraint shows Supervisor
attempting to verbally de-escalate Youth A calmly and her refusing
to go to her room and stating “you will have to restrain me.” When
Supervisor is talking with Youth A about a plan she begins to
scream and hit her head with two closed fists on the top of her
head where the knot on her head was noted. Youth A began to
pace around the room and throw chairs. Once Youth A threw a
chair directly at Supervisor and rushed towards her. Within the
video you see Supervisor and Youth A go against the door/wall
and a bang sound can be heard but due to Supervisor’s position
and camera angle it cannot be determined what caused the noise.
Supervisor attempted to do a standing hold and Youth A’s body
weight went to the ground. Due to the camera angle, it prevented
the ability to see if Youth A or Supervisor hit the wall or the door
when Youth A is dropping to the floor or where Supervisor’s hand
position is. Once Youth A and Supervisor are on the floor you hear
Supervisor call out for assistance and that Youth A needs to get
onto her back. The video shows Supervisor assisting Youth A’s
body to roll and Staff 2 securing Youth A’s shoulder and Staff 3
and Staff 4 securing her legs. Supervisor then states they need to
get Youth A up and into her room. This is when you see
Supervisor and Staff 2 assist with lifting her upper body and Staff
3 lifting up Youth A’s legs. As they are guiding her to her room,
Youth A’s legs are off the ground and Supervisor tells the team to
put her legs down. Once they cross the threshold of Youth A’s
door the team is out of camera angle. From the video standpoint,
it is believed Youth A’s legs were off the ground for about 5
seconds before the video cuts off. The video does not show
Supervisor grabbing Youth A by the neck or punching her.
Documents Reviewed:
10

- Incident Report dated 03/06/23- This incident report was
completed by Supervisor and was consistent with his
interview.
- Youth A’s Medical documentation- On 03/06/2023 at
11:18pm, Youth A was seen by nursing after the restraint.
She reported to nursing “I’m straight” when asked if she
needed any medical attention. On 03/07/2023 at 7:20pm,
Youth A requested to see a nurse and when nurse went to
talk to Youth A, she declined any medical needs. On
03/08/2023, Youth A was seen at the nurse clinic and staff
performed a range of motion with all her limbs. There was
no decrease in range in motion, but Youth A did complain
of muscle soreness between scapula’s. Medication was
given.
- Facility Training and Staff Development Policy (Rev.
12/22/22) states Youth Specialists, Professional
Specialists, Shift Supervisors & Administrators are required
to complete a “Use of Force” training on a yearly basis.
- Facility Management Policy: Fights, Disturbances and
Use of Force and/or Restraints (Rev. 12/21/22) states
Detention staff may use physical force to prevent imminent
injury to a youth or to another person.
- Human Resource File for Supervisor- Supervisor had no
disciplinary actions noted within his HR file. Supervisor’s
training file was reviewed and noted to be up to date on all
training requirements. He completed CPI Refresher
Training on 05/12/22. Supervisor is scheduled to complete
a new refresher training in March 2023.
- Human Resource File for Staff 3- Staff 3 began working
for the facility in mid-January 2023. There are no
disciplinary actions noted within his HR file. Staff 3
completed all his required onboarding training and
completed CPI training on 01/26/23.
- Licensing Special Investigation 2023C0000175- This
investigation was opened on 01/17/23 due to concerns of
an improper restraint involving Supervisor. It was found the
facility was in noncompliance with the use of proper
restraint technique because Supervisor completed a bear
hug hold on a youth which is not compliant with their
restraint model.
- CPI Training Material- Consultant received the training
material for the CPI restraint model that all staff at the
facility are trained on. The staff followed the key principle of
limiting Youth A’s range of motion. The staff have reported
the knowledge of knowing the Children’s Control Position,
11

Emergency Floor Hold (Supine), and the way to transition
the youth from seated to standing. It notes with the
Emergency Floor Hold (Supine) staff should not lift the feet
or legs off the floor, which Staff 3 did.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance with following a proper
restraint due to Staff 3 lifting Youth A’s legs off the ground when
trying to assist her from a floor restraint to a standing restraint.
Supervisor did redirect Staff 3 immediately that this was improper
and to drop the Youth A’s legs to the ground. There is no
evidence found to support that Youth A was grabbed by her neck
or punched during the restraint. It was noted within the interviews
Supervisor’s hand may have moved down to her chest area when
Youth A dropped her body weight to the floor but never had his
hand around her neck or constricted her airways. It was found
Youth A had a knot on her head after the restraint which may have
been caused by her punching herself with her two closed fists
before the restraint, but it is not seen on video that Supervisor hit
her head against the wall/door.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2023C000175 dated 02/23/23, CAP approved 03/27/23
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
